intro: Hydrolea ovata, commonly known as the oval leaf hydrolea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its oval-shaped leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Hydrolea ovata is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
